subtitle: Keep the cord stump clean and dry
description: Keep the cord stump clean and dry
title: How to care for your baby’s cord
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Keep your baby's cord stump clean and dry until it drops off. Do not put anything on it. The cord will heal by itself and will drop off in about a week. It will look quite black and odd but that is part of the healing.

If the cord stump is red, bleeding or smelly, take your baby to a health worker.

If your baby’s cord stump gets dirty, it could become infected. Infections are very dangerous to young babies. Keep the cord stump clean and dry. Use clean, boiled salty water to clean the cord once daily, then make sure to dry it carefully with a clean towel or cloth.

Your family may suggest that you put other substances on the stump to help it heal. Do not let them do this. It is dangerous. Explain that keeping it clean and dry is safest for your baby. 

After washing your baby, simply pat the cord area dry with a clean towel. If you are in a health facility, they may give you something to clean the cord with.

The cord will heal gradually and drop off in a few days. Do not pull on it. Let it fall off naturally. If your baby’s cord has not fallen after 7 days, it could be infected.

If the cord stump is red, sore, and smelly or oozes pus, or your baby gets a fever, there is an infection. Show your baby to the health worker as soon as you can.

The best thing you can do for your baby is to keep the cord stump clean and dry.
